1322.text:
In order to gain the 1322 or 1322+ role for Broughy's streams, you need to be in his Discord and have any applicable YouTube or Twitch accounts linked to your Discord account. Then do `!roles` in <#395879804236464128> to trigger a role check.

1322: YT members, Twitch subscribers, Broughy's regulars
1322+: Anyone on Broughy's Discord

fps.text:
In order for your lap times to save, you need to be running the game at 60FPS. This is because the GTA engine doesn't handle crazy FPS numbers very well, which can cause differences in vehicle performance.

Instructions on how to limit your FPS can be found at: https://wiki.phomecoming.com/doku.php?id=faq:fpslimt

register.text: For information on how to register, <#388989274156040193>

fetching.text: If you're unable to open the F7 menu and it says ``Fetching Perms`` at the bottom of the screen, reconnect to the server.

rookie.text:
In order to gain the Rookie role, all you need to do is finish races without DNFing, being binned or kicked. This role is assigned automatically when you meet the necessary requirements.
*We won't tell you what the requirements are, so don't ask.*

regular.text:
In order to gain the Regular role, all you need to do is finish races without DNFing, being binned or kicked. This role is assigned automatically when you meet the necessary requirements.
*We won't tell you what the requirements are, so don't ask.*

euserver.text: There are no plans to set up a server in Europe. We have players from all over the world and the current server location (New York) is the best middle-ground option to enable everyone to play on the same server.

streamer.text: To gain the Streaming role, link your Twitch account to your Discord, enable Streaming Mode, and connect to one of the Homecoming servers while streaming. The role will be applied automatically.

wiki.text:
The Project Homecoming Wiki can be found at https://wiki.phomecoming.com/
*NOTE: Some information might be a tad outdated. Always refer to Discord for the most up-to-date information.*

kick.text:
All kicks, regardless of the reason, come with a 1-hour automated timeout.
**This timeout cannot be lifted manually.**

clip.text: Good places to upload a video clip https://streamable.com/ https://youtube.com/

queue.text: We do not have a queue system, nor are we planning to implement one. There are too many technical and logistical issues to make it a viable option. Check out <#388989274156040193> Q20 for information on how to increase your chances of getting on.

whitelist.text:
Special events have a whitelist applied to limit who can join and who can't.

In addition some streamers occasionally use their whitelists. To gain either the 1322 or EMDT roles for whitelisting purposes, join Broughy's Discord for 1322 and Baron's or Sarah's Discord for EMDT respectively and do ``!roles`` in #charlie to trigger a roles check.

Event roles are applied automatically when you sign up.

troll.text: Please read the pinned messages in #troll-cave to see why you have this role, what it means, and how to get rid of it.

stringsort.text: thats how strings are sorted. Uppercase and then lowercase.

objs.text: You can find templates and OBJs for most of the vehicles on Homecoming at https://p-h-c.xyz/phobjs

specs.text:
1. Download CPU-Z at <https://www.cpuid.com/softwares/cpu-z.html>
2. Open CPU-Z
3. Click "Validate"
4. Click "Submit"
5. Post link here.
*(Optional) 6. Go to Documents > Rockstar Games > GTA V and post the Settings.xml file here*

cops.text:
If you get a 2-star wanted level for any reason, you will be automatically sin-binned to both prevent you from bringing cops to the race staging area (and consecutively to the race) and to promote good behaviour between races.

*If you notice yourself getting a 1-star wanted level, it's a good idea to hit F6 -> Player -> Suicide.*

random.text: Random races are hosted randomly (appropriately enough). Please do not ask the host for randoms, as it can get really tiring to field those requests constantly.

stats.text:
Statsite: <http://stats.phomecoming.com/>
*P.S. Charliebot will ping you if you've been promoted. There's no need to keep checking every day.*

ticket.text: The error message along the lines of `No citizenFX ticket was specified. Blahblahblah.` means that the FiveM services are having issues. This isn't something we can affect, so you just have to be patient and try again later. You can also check the support channels on the FiveM Discord. Those usually light up when there's a global FiveM issue.

f7.text: If you're having trouble getting the Charlie menu to show up, try reconnecting. If that doesn't work, make sure "Switch to Trevor" is bound to F7. If your keyboard has media keys and such bound to the F-keys, make sure there's not some Fn-toggle active.

obs.text: A quick guide on how to set up OBS for recording races: https://wiki.phomecoming.com/doku.php?id=faq:obs

blackscreen.text:
If you join a race and get stuck on a  black screen, press `F8` and enter the command `blackscreen` in the console. This will reset you and enable you to try joining the race again. 

Note that you might just blackscreen again on the next attempt, but you should at least be able to join the next race without having to reconnect to the server.

join.text: In order to join a race all you need to do is join a racing server, wait for a race to be hosted and follow the instructions that show up at the bottom of the screen.

launcher.text:
**Try the snazzy Homecoming Launcher today!**
It comes with such amazing features as:
* Convenient one-click connecting!
* Player lists so you can see if your nemesis is on the server or not!
* Track lists! Don't know where to find that sick track people are talking about? Worry no more!
* Out of ideas? Use the randomiser and let it decide for you!
* Want to make the launcher look like absolute ass? Now you can with customisable colours!
* More features coming as Applez gets everything sorted!

**Get yours by grabbing the installer from the pinned messages in <#756793848985944094>!**

disconnect.text:
**__If you've lost access to your account, do the following:__**

**Discord:** 
1) Connect to the Testing server by pressing `F8` in the FiveM client and typing `connect testing.phomecoming.com`
2) Enter the command `/unregister` in chat
3) Reconnect to the server
4) Get your new code from the `Discord` menu that should be available to you under `F7`
5) Enter new code in <#395879804236464128> with the command `!discord <your_code_here>`
**__Do this only if you've lost access to your old Discord account.__**

**Steam:**
1) Enter the command `!unregister` in <#395879804236464128> to disconnect your current account
2) Connect to the Testing server by pressing `F8` in the FiveM client and typing `connect testing.phomecoming.com`
3) Get your new code from the `Discord` menu that should be available to you under `F7`
4) Enter new code in <#395879804236464128> with the command `!discord <your_code_here>`
**__This is only if you've lost your Steam account.__**
*NOTE: Changing your linked Steam account will reset your rank progress, race data, and saved vehicles.*

ip.text: You can find the addresses for the servers in the <#388989274156040193>. A lot of other useful information there as well, so go read it.

spam.text:
If you see the message `Spam Timeout` when trying to connect, it means that you have been connecting too many times in a short period of time and have been given an automated 48-hour ban.

Connection spamming can cause several issues, including server instability, so this is our way of discouraging people from doing it.
**This ban cannot be lifted manually.**

For information on how to connect in a more measured manner, check out <#388989274156040193> Q20.

cache.text:
**To clear the FiveM cache do the following:**
* Close the FiveM client
* Delete `%localappdata%\FiveM.app\data\server-cache-priv`
* Start FiveM and connect to one of the servers

**NOTE: Clearing the cache is to be used as the absolute last resort, as it means you'll have to download all the custom assets again. Do this only if** ***__everything__*** **else has failed.**

binned.text: If you're unclear on why you got binned, either **politely** ask the host after the race or wait for them to fill in the bin report in <#820276170871930900>.

faq.text:
Please read the FAQ at <#388989274156040193>. Everything you need to know is explained there.

Just go ahead and read it. It'll make both of our lives easier if you do.

Seriously, read it. Don't skim trough it. **Read it.**

s3.text:
In lieu of some streamers showing up again, we've set up a third server once more. You can connect to it at `race3.phomecoming.com`.

*Note: No results, no status bot, but stats are being tracked, so they'll count towards promotions.*

donate.text:
Sorry, but Project Homecoming does not accept donations. This is a passion project and in our experience money always ruins such things. 

If you want to give to the community, you can gift some Nitro (Post gift links in <#395391595350065153> just in case there are some bots camping general chat for gift links). 

Or buy yourself something nice. You deserve it ;)

reply.text:
Make sure you disable the reply notification when replying to messages by the management. 
For many of us, a ping means that something just went kaboom and finding that it was someone going "omg lol" to something we said is very infuriating.

So PLEASE make sure you turn the ping off when replying by clicking this little thing before pressing enter.

fivem.text: To join the FiveM Discord (cfx.re Project Hub), search for `cfx.re` in the "Explore Public Servers" section of your Discord client.

logs.text: If you've installed FiveM in the default location, your log files can be found in `%localappdata%\FiveM\Fivem.app\logs`.

blueflags.text: If you're unclear on how to blue flag effectively, check out this handy instructional video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-O1nKADFSp0

otl.text:
**OTL stands for "Off-Road Traction Loss".** 
This is a multiplier value in the handling file of each vehicle that reduces the amount of grip on low traction surfaces (dirt, gravel, some stunt props, etc). The higher the value, the worse the vehicle will perform. Default value is 1.0.

testing.text: Read the announcement regarding the testing licenses at https://discord.com/channels/388742985619079188/388788535521443840/854984359383531541

boosting.text:
Here's Sarah's comprehensive write-up on all the different kinds of boosts and other little tricks and tips on how to get that extra little bit out of your lap times.
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/153xjPEI_EJf3rvY-WrgHRByx34SsMKILKEDA7AEaQdQ>

build.text: If FiveM is giving you a "Changing game build failed: An unknown error occurred", make sure your GTA5 installation is up to date.

files.text:
**HOW TO VERIFY YOUR GTA FILES:**

**__Epic Game Store__** 
1) Make sure you've set EGS to auto-update the game (click on the ... menu in your games library and toggle on Auto Update)
2) Verify your files (... menu -> Verify)
3) Log on to GTA Online and see if that'll force an update

**__Steam__**
1) Make sure automatic updates are on (Right-click the game in your Library and choose Properties -> Updates -> "Always keep this game updated")
2) Verify your files (Right-click, Properties -> Local Files -> Verify integrity of game files...)
3) Log on to GTA Online and see if that'll force an update

**__Rockstar Launcher__**
1) Click the Settings in the top right -> Select GTA V from the list on the left -> Click "Verify Integrity"

audiocrash.text:
**If you're getting a gta-core-five.dll error when connecting to any of the Homecoming servers, try the following:**
1) Set your `FiveM.exe` to run in Vista SP1 compatibility mode (You might need to apply the mode for all users to ensure it's always running in that mode.)

2) Unplug any and all USB devices that have audio inputs/outputs (like a headset or webcam with a microphone, etc.) You can reconnect the device(s) once you've connected to the server.


**The full error is as follows:**
```gta-core-five.dll!Microsoft::WRL::ComPtr<IDirectSoundCaptureBuffer>::InternalRelease (0x11)```
__
__
